sentences.sContent: Jesse was an outlaw, a bandit, a criminal.
sentences.sCn: 杰西曾是个逃犯、土匪、罪犯。

sentences.sContent: In some states gambling was outlawed.
sentences.sCn: 在一些州赌博被宣布为非法。

sentences.sContent: The German government has outlawed some fascist groups.
sentences.sCn: 德国政府已宣布一些法西斯团体为非法。

synos.tran: 歹徒；罪犯；亡命之徒；被剥夺法律保护者

remMethod.val: out(超过) + law(法律) → 超出法律范围 → 宣布…为非法， 使…成为非法

words.tran: 被宣布为非法；非法化；逍遥法外

trans.tranCn: 亡命之徒，逃犯，被剥夺法律权益者
trans.tranOther: someone who has done something illegal, and who is hiding in order to avoid punishment – used especially about criminals in the past

trans.tranCn: 宣布…为非法， 使…成为非法
trans.tranOther: When something is outlawed, it is made illegal
